theory: Energy Steroids are connected to the ancient weapons or Fishman evolution. The rapid aging and transformation effects hint at a deeper connection to Fish-Man Island's history and possibly Joy Boy's promise.
author: Various Reddit users on r/OnePiece
evidence: Energy Steroids cause dramatic physical changes similar to other ancient substances in One Piece
The steroids are described as a 'national treasure' suggesting historical significance
The side effects (rapid aging) seem unnatural and possibly artificial
counterEvidence: Limited information about the origin of Energy Steroids
May simply be a plot device to show the desperation of the antagonists

theory: Hody Jones represents pure hatred without cause - a thematic exploration of how racism and hatred can be passed down through generations even without direct experience of oppression.
author: Multiple One Piece community members
evidence: Hody's backstory reveals he never experienced direct human oppression
His hatred is learned from the environment of Fish-Man District
Episode 560 shows his ruthlessness even toward former allies like Vander Decken

theory: The underwater battle choreography and Luffy's new techniques foreshadow his eventual mastery of advanced combat in different environments, preparing him for future challenges.
author: YouTube anime analysts
evidence: Gomu Gomu no Snake Shot debut in Episode 560 shows evolution of Luffy's fighting style
Underwater combat requires different tactics than land battles
Post-timeskip techniques show more creativity and variety
